title: Em dash at start of line?!?
content:
So im working a paragraph which contains an em dash, this thing just keeps wanting to fall right at the beginging of the second line down in an indented paragraph.   
   
Example:   
   
 (indent)Blah s;ldf;sdflka'a;lkasfjnfoiwenf   
-- werkwerl;kwerkl;wer;lkwe;. weriowre;iwe   
weroewrlkewrjfisdfjflkwlwerj.   
   
This sort of thing.   
   
Whats your thoughts on this? Bad Good? can I get away with it? Its really bothering me quite a lot.   
   
hildebrant.
author: Hildebrant

comments.content:
If you don't want it to start at the line, which I think would look kind of awkward, use a soft return after it to force it to start at the end of the first line.   
   
If that still doesn't work, adjust your tracking a bit.
